creditline: The Modernism Collection, gift of Norwest Bank Minnesota
description: Black lacquer background with inlaid coquille d'oeuf (crushed eggshell)
medium: Lacquer on copper, coquille d'oeuf (crushed eggshell)
text:
In 1912 Jean Dunand traded his extensive knowledge of metalworking for Seizo Sugawara's well-kept lacquer-working secrets, then parlayed them into an astonishing series of lacquerwork.

Dunand's signature style is his use of eggshell lacquer particles of crushed eggshell were painstakingly placed into a fresh lacquer. So successful did this beome that Dunand maintained his own flock of chickns to provide eggshells of suitable quality and color.
title: Plateau from a dresser set
